Classes/MedAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.name: staticImages
Classes/MedAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.abstract: A list of static objects

Classes/MedAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.name: movableImages
Classes/MedAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.abstract: A list of movable objects

Classes/MedAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.name: game_delegate
Classes/MedAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.abstract: The referenced GameViewController that created this scene. Weak storage is used so that the instance is deleted once the scene is deleted. If strong storage is used here, duplicate untouchable GameViewControllers will be created

Classes/MedAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.name: contactFlag
Classes/MedAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.abstract: Boolean that states whether selected Node is in contact with bucket or not

Classes/MedAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.name: movingFlag
Classes/MedAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.abstract: Boolean that states whether selected Node is moved (drageed) or not. If yes, change the zPosition of the node to be +2 than other nodes, so as to aboid collision

Classes/MedAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.name: ausCrateFlag
Classes/MedAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.abstract: Boolean that states whether the selected node is recently moved out of crate. Used for Voiceover hinting. P.S that aus comes from German and kinda means out of

Classes/MedAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.name: backgroundNode
Classes/MedAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.abstract: the node that contains the background

Classes/MedAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.name: selectedNode
Classes/MedAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.abstract: The sprite that is currently being touched (if any)

Classes/MedAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.name: winningStreak
Classes/MedAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.abstract: How many times the player has won the current game

Classes/MedAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.name: backButton
Classes/MedAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.abstract: Button to return to the memu

Classes/MedAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.name: numInCrate
Classes/MedAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.abstract: same as answer variable, numInCrate keep track of the objects put in the bucket

Classes/MedAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.name: nodeOriginalPosition
Classes/MedAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.abstract: Original position of node currently being moved

Classes/MedAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.name: rightObjectType
Classes/MedAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.abstract: the type of object that’s asked, picked randomly from the list of movableImages

Classes/MedAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.name: numberText
Classes/MedAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.abstract: label that shows the current number of objects in crate

Classes/MedAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.name: correctNum
Classes/MedAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.abstract: correctNum is the variable of the answer to the game task, randomly generated with a range btn 1 to 5

Classes/MedAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.name: numA
Classes/MedAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.abstract: one of the question number to appear in the question text, randomly generated within the range of correctNum

Classes/MedAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.name: numB
Classes/MedAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.abstract: the other question number in question text. numA + numB = correctNum

Classes/MedAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.name: gameTask
Classes/MedAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.abstract: The label that shows the task (or question) for the given level

Classes/MedAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.name: typeNode
Classes/MedAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.abstract: Node that displays the type of object asked for answer.

Classes/MedAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.name: crate
Classes/MedAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.abstract: crate node where you have to drag object node to

Classes/MedAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.name: numIndicator
Classes/MedAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.abstract: label that shows the current number in crate to question

Classes/MedAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.name: objList
Classes/MedAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.abstract: the list of object nodes you can drag to crate node

Classes/MedAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.name: winningStreakText
Classes/MedAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.abstract: Accessibility label of the winning streak indicator on scene

Classes/MedAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.name: fx
Classes/MedAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.abstract: SoundFX object to play corresponding sounds

Classes/MedAdditionScene.html#/c:@M@Math.name: didMove(to:)
Classes/MedAdditionScene.html#/c:@M@Math.abstract: Set up sprites on the screen at their correct position

Classes/MedAdditionScene.html#/c:@M@Math.name: touchesMoved(_:with:)
Classes/MedAdditionScene.html#/c:@M@Math.abstract: Handles single finger drag on device and moves touched object if it is a member of movableImages

Classes/MedAdditionScene.html#/c:@M@Math.name: touchesEnded(_:with:)
Classes/MedAdditionScene.html#/c:@M@Math.abstract: Handles event when touch is lifted. Increments score if apple is in contact with pig. Returns object to original position if wrong object of pig or drag went outside of the screen’s borders

Classes/MedAdditionScene.html#/c:@M@Math.name: didBegin(_:)
Classes/MedAdditionScene.html#/c:@M@Math.abstract: Called when contact between two objects is initiated

Classes/MedAdditionScene.html#/c:@M@Math.name: didEnd(_:)
Classes/MedAdditionScene.html#/c:@M@Math.abstract: Called when contact between two objects is finished

Classes/MedAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.name: onSpriteTouch(touchedNode:)
Classes/MedAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.abstract: Clears out wobble action from selected node and makes touched node wobble

Classes/MedAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.name: generateObjList()
Classes/MedAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.abstract: The function that randomly generates a list of 10 objects to be added to the scene. Ensured that the list contains enough right objects to finish the tasks. Returns the generated object list

Classes/MedAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.name: updateAnswer(node:add:)
Classes/MedAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.abstract: Update the score for the level

Classes/MedAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.name: evaluate()
Classes/MedAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.abstract: evaluate the current answer and the correct number. If matched, remove all fruit objects and bucket object then display the victory text and the button to continue playing, or if winning streak is reached, the button to go to next level

Classes/MedAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.name: shakeCamera(layer:duration:)
Classes/MedAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.abstract: shake the screen

Classes/MedAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.name: generateStreakBar()
Classes/MedAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.abstract: Generate sprites for winning streak bar

Classes/MedAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.name: zeroStreakBar()

Classes/MedAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.name: onVictory()
Classes/MedAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.abstract: Undocumented

Classes/MedAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.name: speakString(text:)
Classes/MedAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.abstract: Prompts text to be spoken out by device

Classes/AppDelegate.html#/c:@M@MathFarm@.name: window
Classes/AppDelegate.html#/c:@M@MathFarm@.abstract: UI Window that correspondings to where the app is being run

Classes/AppDelegate.html#/c:@M@MathFarm@.name: application(_:didFinishLaunchingWithOptions:)
Classes/AppDelegate.html#/c:@M@MathFarm@.abstract: Override point for customization after application launch.

Classes/AppDelegate.html#/c:@M@MathFarm@.name: applicationWillResignActive(_:)
Classes/AppDelegate.html#/c:@M@MathFarm@.abstract: Sent when the application is about to move from active to inactive state. This can occur for certain types of temporary interruptions (such as an incoming phone call or SMS message) or when the user quits the application and it begins the transition to the background state. Use this method to pause ongoing tasks, disable timers, and invalidate graphics rendering callbacks. Games should use this method to pause the game.

Classes/AppDelegate.html#/c:@M@MathFarm@.name: applicationDidEnterBackground(_:)
Classes/AppDelegate.html#/c:@M@MathFarm@.abstract: Use this method to release shared resources, save user data, invalidate timers, and store enough application state information to restore your application to its current state in case it is terminated later. If your application supports background execution, this method is called instead of applicationWillTerminate: when the user quits.

Classes/AppDelegate.html#/c:@M@MathFarm@.name: applicationWillEnterForeground(_:)
Classes/AppDelegate.html#/c:@M@MathFarm@.abstract: Called as part of the transition from the background to the active state; here you can undo many of the changes made on entering the background.

Classes/AppDelegate.html#/c:@M@MathFarm@.name: applicationDidBecomeActive(_:)
Classes/AppDelegate.html#/c:@M@MathFarm@.abstract: Restart any tasks that were paused (or not yet started) while the application was inactive. If the application was previously in the background, optionally refresh the user interface.

Classes/AppDelegate.html#/c:@M@MathFarm@.name: applicationWillTerminate(_:)
Classes/AppDelegate.html#/c:@M@MathFarm@.abstract: Called when the application is about to terminate. Save data if appropriate. See also applicationDidEnterBackground

Classes/EasyPatternController.html#/c:@M.name: zeroAnimal
Classes/EasyPatternController.html#/c:@M.abstract: each of the below outlets are connected to a UIButton element on the screen to be altered throughout the easy pattern game

Classes/EasyPatternController.html#/s:8M.name: fillAnimalDetails()
Classes/EasyPatternController.html#/s:8M.abstract: uses the currently selected pattern to fill in the appropriate images and accessibility labels in the view; also sets tag representing UIButton placement on the screen

Classes/EasyPatternController.html#/c:@M.name: selectAnswer0(_:)
Classes/EasyPatternController.html#/c:@M.abstract: func that is called when user selected first answer choice possible

Classes/EasyPatternController.html#/c:@M.name: selectAnswer1(_:)
Classes/EasyPatternController.html#/c:@M.abstract: func that is called when user selects second answer choice possible

Classes/EasyPatternController.html#/c:@M.name: tappedAnimal(_:)
Classes/EasyPatternController.html#/c:@M.abstract: plays an animal sound corresponding to the animal that has just been tapped

Classes/EasyPatternController.html#/c:@M.name: checkAnswer(_:)
Classes/EasyPatternController.html#/c:@M.abstract: called when user taps the continue arrow: if answer is correct, then segues to great job screen, else resets answer choice and resumes play of current pattern

Classes/EasyPatternController.html#/s:8M.abstract: responsible for replacing the ? box with the selected answer

Classes/EasyPatternController.html#/s:8M.abstract: shifts focus of VoiceOver selection box to the first animal in the pattern

Classes/EasyPatternController.html#/s:8M.name: shiftFocusContinueButton()
Classes/EasyPatternController.html#/s:8M.abstract: shifts focus of the VoiceOver selection box to the continue arrow; to be called after a user selects an answer choice

Classes/AdvAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.abstract: The sprite that is currently being touched (if any)

Classes/AdvAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.name: winningStreak
Classes/AdvAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.abstract: How many times the player has won the current game

Classes/AdvAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.name: backButton
Classes/AdvAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.abstract: Button to return to the memu

Classes/AdvAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.name: numInCrate
Classes/AdvAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.abstract: same as answer variable, numInCrate keep track of the objects put in the bucket

Classes/AdvAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.name: objNumChangce
Classes/AdvAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.abstract: used to keep track of the number of object node that enters/leaves crate. Used to fulfill the VoiceOver accessibility to announce how many number of objects are put in/ moved outta crate

Classes/AdvAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.name: nodeOriginalPosition
Classes/AdvAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.abstract: Original position of node currently being moved

Classes/AdvAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.name: rightObjectType
Classes/AdvAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.abstract: the type of object that’s asked, picked randomly from the list of movableImages

Classes/AdvAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.name: numberText
Classes/AdvAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.abstract: label that shows the current number of objects in crate

Classes/AdvAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.name: correctNum
Classes/AdvAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.abstract: correctNum is the variable of the answer to the game task, randomly generated with a range btn 1 to 5

Classes/AdvAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.name: correctObjNum
Classes/AdvAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.abstract: correctObjNum is the number of the object nodes that is guaranteed to constitute a valid solution. There is 2 to 3 of such nodes in each game, with the number of nodes randomly generated

Classes/AdvAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.name: fakeCorrectObjNum
Classes/AdvAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.abstract: fakeCorrectObjNum is the number of the object nodes that is guaranteed to be right object type but added in addition to the guaranteed solution nodes. In a sense they are the dummy variable added to confuse the player, but it is possible that the player can use these nodes to construct a valid answer. There is 1 to 2 of such nodes in each game, with the number of nodes randomly generated

Classes/AdvAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.name: numA
Classes/AdvAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.abstract: one of the question number to appear in the question text, randomly generated within the range of correctNum

Classes/AdvAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.name: numB
Classes/AdvAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.abstract: the other question number in question text. numA + numB = correctNum

Classes/AdvAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.name: gameTask
Classes/AdvAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.abstract: The label that shows the task (or question) for the given level

Classes/AdvAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.name: typeNode
Classes/AdvAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.abstract: Node that displays the type of object asked for answer.

Classes/AdvAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.name: objTypeList
Classes/AdvAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.abstract: the list that contains the list of object nodes’ type

Classes/AdvAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.name: objNumList
Classes/AdvAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.abstract: the list that contains the list of object nodes’ number

Classes/AdvAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.name: winningStreakText
Classes/AdvAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.abstract: Accessibility label of the winning streak indicator on scene

Classes/AdvAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.name: fx
Classes/AdvAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.abstract: SoundFX object to play corresponding sounds

Classes/AdvAdditionScene.html#/c:@M@Math.name: didMove(to:)
Classes/AdvAdditionScene.html#/c:@M@Math.abstract: Set up sprites on the screen at their correct position

Classes/AdvAdditionScene.html#/c:@M@Math.name: touchesMoved(_:with:)
Classes/AdvAdditionScene.html#/c:@M@Math.abstract: Handles single finger drag on device and moves touched object if it is a member of movableImages

Classes/AdvAdditionScene.html#/c:@M@Math.name: touchesEnded(_:with:)
Classes/AdvAdditionScene.html#/c:@M@Math.abstract: Handles event when touch is lifted. Increments score if apple is in contact with pig. Returns object to original position if wrong object of pig or drag went outside of the screen’s borders

Classes/AdvAdditionScene.html#/c:@M@Math.name: didBegin(_:)
Classes/AdvAdditionScene.html#/c:@M@Math.abstract: Called when contact between two objects is initiated

Classes/AdvAdditionScene.html#/c:@M@Math.name: didEnd(_:)
Classes/AdvAdditionScene.html#/c:@M@Math.abstract: Called when contact between two objects is finished

Classes/AdvAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.name: onSpriteTouch(touchedNode:)
Classes/AdvAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.abstract: Clears out wobble action from selected node and makes touched node wobble

Classes/AdvAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.name: generateObjList()
Classes/AdvAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.abstract: the function that randomly generate two list of ten strings, one stating the object type of object node and the other the number the corresponding node carries. It conforms that: There is at least one correct solution; that minimum solution takes 2 - 3 nodes; there will be 1 - 2 guaranteed dummy variables.

Classes/AdvAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.name: updateAnswer(node:add:)
Classes/AdvAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.abstract: Update the score for the level

Classes/AdvAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.name: evaluate()
Classes/AdvAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.abstract: evaluate the current answer and the correct number. If matched, remove all fruit objects and bucket object then display the victory text and the button to continue playing, or if winning streak is reached, the button to go to next level

Classes/AdvAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.name: shakeCamera(layer:duration:)
Classes/AdvAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.abstract: shake the screen

Classes/AdvAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.name: generateStreakBar()
Classes/AdvAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.abstract: Generate sprites for winning streak bar

Classes/AdvAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.name: zeroStreakBar()
Classes/AdvAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.abstract: helper method for generateStreakBar. Remove prior streak bar nodes before adding new ones

Classes/AdvAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.name: onVictory()
Classes/AdvAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.abstract: Called when the correct number of objects are in the crate, removes all other game objects (other than back button), prompts victory text and the button to continue playing, or if winning streak is reached, the button to go to next level.

Classes/AdvAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.name: speakString(text:)
Classes/AdvAdditionScene.html#/s:8MathFa.abstract: Prompts text to be spoken out by device

Classes/LevelSelectController.html#/c:@M.name: didReceiveMemoryWarning()
Classes/LevelSelectController.html#/c:@M.abstract: Dispose of any resources that can be recreated.

Classes/LevelSelectController.html#/c:@M.name: toCountingEasy(_:)
Classes/LevelSelectController.html#/c:@M.abstract: Transitions to GameViewController to present counting level

Classes/LevelSelectController.html#/c:@M.name: prepare(for:sender:)
Classes/LevelSelectController.html#/c:@M.abstract: Sets the game type of the GameViewController recieving the segue according to the segue identifier.

Classes/PatternLevelMedium.html#/s:8Math.name: possiblePatterns
Classes/PatternLevelMedium.html#/s:8Math.abstract: this array contains all possible patterns that can appear in numerical, integer format; the first 5 integers represent the first animals in the pattern, the 6th int represents the answer, and the last 2 ints are the answer choices

Classes/PatternLevelMedium.html#/s:8Math.name: animalImages
Classes/PatternLevelMedium.html#/s:8Math.abstract: this array contains the images of the animals that correspond to the names

Classes/PatternLevelMedium.html#/s:8Math.name: animalNames
Classes/PatternLevelMedium.html#/s:8Math.abstract: this array contains the string names of each animal corresponding to 0,1,2,3 respectively

Classes/PatternLevelMedium.html#/s:8Math.name: init()
Classes/PatternLevelMedium.html#/s:8Math.abstract: on initilization of the class, set a random pattern

Classes/PatternLevelMedium.html#/s:8Math.name: getAnimalNameAt(index:)
Classes/PatternLevelMedium.html#/s:8Math.abstract: returns the string animal name at index[0,1,2,3] in animalNames array

Classes/PatternLevelMedium.html#/s:8Math.name: getAnimalImageAt(index:)
Classes/PatternLevelMedium.html#/s:8Math.abstract: returns the UIImage of the animal at the respective index in the animalImages array

Classes/PatternLevelMedium.html#/s:8Math.name: getPattern()
Classes/PatternLevelMedium.html#/s:8Math.abstract: returns the integer representation array of the pattern that is currently chosen

Classes/PatternLevelMedium.html#/s:8Math.name: isAnswerCorrect(animal:)
Classes/PatternLevelMedium.html#/s:8Math.abstract: takes in an animal name as a string, and determines whether or not that animal is the correct answer given the current pattern

Classes/PatternLevelMedium.html#/s:8Math.name: setAndGetNewPattern()
Classes/PatternLevelMedium.html#/s:8Math.abstract: randomly chooses a new pattern, sets it as the current pattern, and returns the integer representation of the pattern; an all-in-one function!

Classes/PatternLevelMedium.html#/s:8Math.name: getAnimalIndex(name:)
Classes/PatternLevelMedium.html#/s:8Math.abstract: NOTE: Not completely tested, so may have a bug. Desired functionality: input an animal name as a string and this will return the index of said animal in the array of animalNames; returns -1 if name not found

Classes/PatternLevelMedium.html#/s:8Math.name: setRandomPattern()
Classes/PatternLevelMedium.html#/s:8Math.abstract: an internal func that selects a random pattern from the array of possiblePatterns, and sets that as the current pattern

Classes/PatternLevelEasy.html#/s:8MathFa.name: possiblePatterns
Classes/PatternLevelEasy.html#/s:8MathFa.abstract: this array contains all possible patterns that can appear in numerical, integer format; the first 3 integers represent the first animals in the pattern, the 4th int represents the answer, and the last 2 ints are the answer choices

Classes/PatternLevelEasy.html#/s:8MathFa.name: animalImages
Classes/PatternLevelEasy.html#/s:8MathFa.abstract: this array contains the images of the animals that correspond to the names

Classes/PatternLevelEasy.html#/s:8MathFa.name: animalNames
Classes/PatternLevelEasy.html#/s:8MathFa.abstract: this array contains the string names of each animal corresponding to 0,1,2,3 respectively

Classes/PatternLevelEasy.html#/s:8MathFa.name: init()
Classes/PatternLevelEasy.html#/s:8MathFa.abstract: on initilization of the class, set a random pattern

Classes/PatternLevelEasy.html#/s:8MathFa.name: getAnimalNameAt(index:)
Classes/PatternLevelEasy.html#/s:8MathFa.abstract: returns the string animal name at index[0,1,2,3] in animalNames array

Classes/PatternLevelEasy.html#/s:8MathFa.name: getAnimalImageAt(index:)
Classes/PatternLevelEasy.html#/s:8MathFa.abstract: returns the UIImage of the animal at the respective index in the animalImages array

Classes/PatternLevelEasy.html#/s:8MathFa.name: getPattern()
Classes/PatternLevelEasy.html#/s:8MathFa.abstract: returns the integer representation array of the pattern that is currently chosen

Classes/PatternLevelEasy.html#/s:8MathFa.name: isAnswerCorrect(animal:)
Classes/PatternLevelEasy.html#/s:8MathFa.abstract: takes in an animal name as a string, and determines whether or not that animal is the correct answer given the current pattern

Classes/PatternLevelEasy.html#/s:8MathFa.name: setAndGetNewPattern()
Classes/PatternLevelEasy.html#/s:8MathFa.abstract: randomly chooses a new pattern, sets it as the current pattern, and returns the integer representation of the pattern; an all-in-one function!

Classes/PatternLevelEasy.html#/s:8MathFa.name: getAnimalIndex(name:)
Classes/PatternLevelEasy.html#/s:8MathFa.abstract: NOTE: Not completely tested, so may have a bug. Desired functionality: input an animal name as a string and this will return the index of said animal in the array of animalNames; returns -1 if name not found

Classes/PatternLevelEasy.html#/s:8MathFa.name: setRandomPattern()
Classes/PatternLevelEasy.html#/s:8MathFa.abstract: an internal func that selects a random pattern from the array of possiblePatterns, and sets that as the current pattern

Classes/SoundFX.html#/s:8MathFarm7SoundF.name: isPlaying()
Classes/SoundFX.html#/s:8MathFarm7SoundF.abstract: Tells whether audio player is currently playing an effect or not

Classes/SoundFX.html.name: SoundFX
Classes/SoundFX.html.abstract: an object that consists of multiple function calls to play sounds; how to use: instantiate SoundFX object, call functions to play sound–look for examples throughout code

Classes/PatternLevelEasy.html.name: PatternLevelEasy
Classes/PatternLevelEasy.html.abstract: this class contains the low-level implementation of the easy pattern difficulty; it contains actual patterns, images, and names of animals

Classes/PatternLevelMedium.html.name: PatternLevelMedium
Classes/PatternLevelMedium.html.abstract: this class contains the low-level implementation of the medium (called pro in-game) pattern difficulty; it contains actual patterns, images, and names of animals

Classes/MediumPatternController.html.name: MediumPatternController
Classes/MediumPatternController.html.abstract: this is the controller responsible for the medium (pro) pattern level; all this controller does is alter the storyboard elements in the current view to create patterns…class is incredibly similar to EasyPatternController, but this accounts for the larger amount of animals

Classes/CountingScene.html.name: CountingScene
Classes/CountingScene.html.abstract: Module that renders a counting levels current state and maintains its corresponding game logic

Classes/GameViewController.html.name: GameViewController
Classes/GameViewController.html.abstract: Controller responsible for presenting a given level

Classes/PatternController.html.name: PatternController
Classes/PatternController.html.abstract: a parent class that the PatternController classes extend

Classes/EasyPatternController.html.name: EasyPatternController
Classes/EasyPatternController.html.abstract: this is the controller responsible for the easiest pattern level; all this controller does is alter the storyboard elements in the current view to create patterns

Classes/AppDelegate.html.name: AppDelegate
Classes/AppDelegate.html.abstract: A component that complements the storyboard by defining application logic for different states of the application with respect to how it is used on the device (open, closed, paused, etc.)
